intro: Stenogyne volanica, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and sturdy, woody structure. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pale green, with a distinctive tubular shape. Stenogyne volanica plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
